questions.question: How many imaginary frequencies will a second order saddle point have?

explanations.b: A second order saddle point is defined as a maximum along two coordinates and minimum along all other coordinates. A maximum along two coordinates will have two two negative eigen values after double derivative of the energy. Both of this eigen values will produce two imaginary frequencies.

questions.question: Which of the following is true?

answers.a: Reactants and products are the only stationary points in SN2 reaction
answers.b: Transition state is not a stationary point
answers.c: Only the transition state is the stationary point
answers.d: All reactants, products and transition states are stationary points

explanations.d: All states which produce 0 eigen values in their first derivative of energy are known as stationary points.

questions.question: The normal mode corresponding to the imaginary frequency in the transition state usually reflects the change in geometry in going from reactants to products.

explanations.a: The only imaginary frequency in the transition state will reflect the coordinate connecting the reactant and product. Any other imaginary frequency may correspond to transition state of a different reaction.

questions.question:
Which of the following statement(s) are correct about the transition state?
  1. It is the maximum energy structure along the reaction coordinate.
  2. It is the minimum energy structure along the reaction coordinate.
  3. It is the maximum energy structure along any direction that is perpendicular to reaction coordinate and passes through the transition state.
  4. It is the minimum energy structure along any direction that is perpendicular to reaction coordinate and passes through the transition state.

explanations.c: A transition state is the highest energy structure along the reaction coordinate and along all directions it is lowest in energy.

questions.question: A linear activated complex having N atoms at the transition state has how many vibrational degrees of freedom?

explanations.b: Linear molecules have 3N-5 degrees of freedom, but at the transition state it will have one less degree of freedom, hence 3N-6.
